body:
I found [a list of websites supporting deflate](https://w3techs.com/technologies/details/ce-deflatecompression) and it looks like a significant number of them don't work with reqwest:

- https://www.roblox.com fails (server unspecified)
- https://www.Seznam.cz works
- https://Asana.com works
- https://Kp.ru/ fails (server: ycalb)
- https://36kr.com/ works
- https://profesionalci.rs/ works
- https://feralf.com/ works
- https://aptglobalmarine.com/ works
- https://Supermami.com.hk/ works

(omitted sites that didn't serve me deflate content)
Would be curious what is different, and why the deflate library we're using is hitting an error only on some sites.

garagehq.deuxfleurs.fr is served by [tricot](https://git.deuxfleurs.fr/Deuxfleurs/tricot). It uses the same crate as reqwest to handle compression (`async-compression`). It's odd that somehow something goes wrong in this context

issue.title: Fix deflate decompression

repository.name: reqwest
repository.description: An easy and powerful Rust HTTP Client

issue.body:
This solve issue 1462 by using 'deflate' algo instead of 'zlib' algo to decompress responses with the 'deflate' Content-Encoding.

The full series of tests (cargo test) still works after this.

My code (see isseu #1462) now works, where I was getting " deflate decompression error" before my patch.

body: Pull request https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/pull/1927  made to solve this problems (it solved it for me...)

FYI, `ZlibDecoder` was introduced by https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/pull/1257 after @blankname correctly pointed out `deflate` content-coding is [specified](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-3.5) as using the zlib format.

It would be nice if there were a middle ground that worked for servers that correctly follow the standard vs the [majority that don't](https://stackoverflow.com/a/9186091/5915221).

I didn't know that... Thanks for pointing it out.

The standard seems misleading, but it's the standard... and what's implemened everywhere.
So my patch broke that :(
It should probably be reverted, with an added comment to avoir future mistakes, unless we could somewhat use the autodetection proposed in #1257.
I'll propose a PR when I find the time.
I've reverted in #1952, to try to get a fix out soon. Anyone is welcome to try adding the ability to try both.

issue.title: `deflate` Decompression Error

labels.name: S-needs-more-info
labels.description: Status: More information is required to understand the issue.

repository.name: reqwest
repository.description: An easy and powerful Rust HTTP Client

issue.body:
## Description

Some websites provide deflate compressed responses that fail to decompress

## Steps to reproduce

1. edit reqwest example code: examples/simple.rs

```
#[tokio::main]
async fn main() -> reqwest::Result<()> {
    let client = reqwest::Client::builder()
        .danger_accept_invalid_certs(true)
        .build()?;

    let response = client.get("https://www.spyfu.com/").send().await?;
    dbg!(response.headers());

    let bytes= response.bytes().await?;
    dbg!(bytes);
    Ok(())
}
```

2. run

```
cargo run --example simple --features deflate
```

3. log

```bash
[examples/simple.rs:8:5] response.headers() = {
    "cache-control": "no-cache",
    "pragma": "no-cache",
    "content-type": "text/html; charset=utf-8",
    "date": "Mon, 05 May 2025 20:28:43 GMT",
    "expires": "-1",
    "vary": "Accept-Encoding, Origin",
    "server": "Microsoft-IIS/10.0",
    "set-cookie": "ASP.NET_SessionId=gqobu335gihmz0s3brfou00g; domain=.spyfu.com; path=/; HttpOnly; SameSite=Lax",
    "x-aspnetmvc-version": "5.2",
    "access-control-allow-origin": "*",
    "x-aspnet-version": "4.0.30319",
    "x-powered-by": "ASP.NET",
}
Error: reqwest::Error { kind: Decode, source: Custom { kind: Other, error: DecompressError(General { msg: None }) } }
```
